job.title: Pursuits Systems Engineer (2021)
job.description:
Nexteer Automotive is looking for a technically skilled and highly focused individual who enjoys developing & integrating mechanical & electrical components into a mechatronic system. The focus of this position is to lead the elicitation of customer requirements and collaborate with the organization to have them understood by sub-system teams in order to develop a design proposal. The System Pursuit Engineer will then lead technical discussions concerning the selected system design with the customer. This opportunity requires daily customer interactions, so excellent technical communication skills are necessary. This position interacts with both internal and external customers to ensure deadlines are met and requirement evaluations are completed. In addition to the customer interface work, the position will require development of new technology & demonstrations of those new designs to find a solution that can meet performance expectations at the lowest cost.
The ideal candidate has experience with vehicle communication networks, MATLAB & Simulink, ECU Calibration & Analysis Software Tools (Vector, Intrepid Control, etc), Microsoft Office and can quickly learn internal tools. The ideal candidate possesses good communication skills, excellent problem-solving techniques, good organization and documentation abilities, knowledge of system synthesis, analysis and verification techniques and a general competency and experience in vehicle dynamics, mechanical systems, electronic systems, and computer hardware and software.
In This Role You Will
Support system requirements decomposition & flow down to various parts of the organization
Own the system design of an Electronic Power Steering system for a vehicle project
Optimize multiple system requirements through flow down and use of multi-disciplinary engineering
Lead technical discussions with a vehicle customer
Be responsible to design to cost & assist in maintaining optimized solutions
Tune vehicle steering characteristics & diagnose/corrects deficiencies in demonstrations & prototypes
Support algorithm development specific to a vehicle customer
Support the development of our product from pursuit of business through award
Be exposed to a rapidly changing business environment and be a focal point of our effort to develop solutions to grow within that environment.
Job Requirements
Preferred: 2-3 years of industry experience
Background in automotive chassis engineering (steering, braking, etc)
Required: the right to work in the US without sponsorship
Required: ability to drive a vehicle and possess a valid driver license
able to make quick physical maneuvers while driving
Education
Required – Bachelors in Electrical, Mechanical or Computer Science Related Engineering
Minimum cumulative GPA requirement of 2.7
Preferred – Masters in Electrical, Mechanical or Computer Science Related Engineering
